meanings.definition: With an oblique or sideways glance.
meanings.sent1: She looked asquint at the strange cat.
meanings.sent2: He glanced asquint at the clock on the wall.
meanings.sent3: The detective peered asquint at the suspect, trying to catch any signs of guilt.
meanings.sent4: The old man watched the children play asquint, reminiscing about his own youth.
meanings.sent5: The owl's eyes gleamed asquint in the darkness, scanning for prey.

meanings.definition: Positioned or turned to one side.
meanings.sent1: The asquint picture frame hung crooked on the wall.
meanings.sent2: She noticed the asquint angle of the book on the shelf.
meanings.sent3: The asquint chair in the waiting room made everyone feel a bit off balance.
meanings.sent4: The asquint tree in the yard leaned towards the setting sun.
meanings.sent5: The asquint road sign pointed in a confusing direction.
